title: People on Boards will and have always hate on the state of the game, don't force a narrative

embed.description: https://imgur.com/2p0KzFO The top page of the gameplay section is filling up with unhappy people about the entire state of the game. I know that people look at the boards and think that it's a low % of the total community, and thus complaints shouldn't be taken too seriously..

body: There's this awful narrative that permeates the boards that back then, people complained less on the boards and people were generally happier with the state of the game back then. This simply is not true, at least from pre season 5 when I started to visit the boards regularly. The level of complaints about the game and the state of the game is almost always consistent, just different champs and changes that are targeted. This is consistent through all metas. People will always be complaining on the boards, and saying that the game is getting worse is just not true.

replies.body:
Buddy, I've been here since Season 3. Make no mistake, the boards (or general forums, as it was known back then) have ALWAYS complained about this game. There must ALWAYS be something to complain about, whether it be Lee Sin, Vayne, Tanks, Assassins, Mages, ADCs and Crit (a staple) or just hating on Riot in general.  I guarantee there has never been a time when the boards had a positive mentality or even neutral one for calmly discussing anything. The boards will always nostalgia goggle themselves and say that the past was always better. 

For all intents, the boards serve for nothing more than an echo chamber and giant circlejerk for people to vent and complain about what they don't like.  I honestly would be happy if Riot just deletes the boards in its entirety, as at this point its literally the same exact people who farm for upvotes on the exact same targets.

It's an interesting problem, I think Cactopus mentioned basically this same thing at one point. By and large, players who go through the effort to find & post on Boards have strong opinions or emotions they want to share.

Nobody comes to just be like 'I think thing X is really average and by golly I need to tell the world that'. 

This doesn't at all mean that complaints posted here aren't valid, but I do think it's important to understand the overall context that players post here in.

Except Cactopus also straight-up called most of the complaint threads on these boards "troll threads" and said he would never read most of them past the thesis statement.  Like all of the Sona threads for example: he said everyone who points out the fact she's unplayable,"Is just a troll."

Sorry, but Cactopus' words don't hold any weight with me, when he can publicly declare his prejudice against the majority of the customer base so matter-of-factly.

Cactopus shouldn't be taken seriously long before that. He is just a typical Redditer there for the memes and lawls, so he just says whatever. The amount of trash talking he has done recently about the boards on Reddit lost 100% of my respect in an instant. He was amusing, but he short of showed his true colors as just another one of "those guys", who prefers to trash talk us from afar as if no one here will ever see it.

Aw, jeez you're going to hafta put me on your naughty list too because I also don't think Sona is 'unplayable'. Like, that's extreme language dude. I'm happy to hear what you dislike or like about the champion but...people play her. Objectively, she is playable. If you start with that assertion, it's may be taken as trolling because it's grounded in strong emotion rather than reality. :( 

**Language on this stuff matters because we can only have productive conversations if we start with a reasonable basis.** The difference in language between 'I dislike Sona because of this aspect of her play' and 'I and the majority of players think Sona is unplayable' is absolutely massive. One of those statements is a reasonable critique and foundation for discussion and one is hyperbole. Hyperbole cannot be reasonably discussed. 



> publicly declare his prejudice against the majority of the customer base so matter-of-factly.

Every time someone makes me say this on Boards I die a little bit: Boards is not the majority of players. Again, **that doesn't mean the opinions here are not valid** but you simply, cannot make the jump from Boards to 'majority'. If I see that jump, again, the discussion has moved into hyperbole. We have a few thousand players who read and post on Boards - that's a lot! But League is a global game. There are players in so many other countries & languages or posting on other social sites, etc. It's hard to see if you only read Boards, but there are a lot of players and, therefore, player opinions out there! **No one forum is or can be representative of the majority.**

Not trying to be rude or defensive when I point these things out; I'm always hoping to shed a light on how we can foster better discussions together as a Boards community. :D

**TL:DR** Hyperbole means we can't have a productive discussion together. No one site or forum can represent 'the majority' of players in Leagues global community.

When Riot responds to so so many criticisms with “Boards is small potion of the player base...League is a global game...Reddit is small portion of the player base...there are lots of other opinions out there”, you can’t just wave away the feeling of marginalization with “that doesn’t mean the opinions here are not valid”, even with bold text. If “no one forum is or can be representative of the majority” then Riot needs to stop acting like the size of the complaining group matters by bringing up the size in responses.

I am bringing this up specifically in regards to this comment (and others I've seen) referencing 'the majority of players'. Wouldn't mention it otherwise because I don't want folks to feel bad on/about any platform they choose to come hang out on, for sure! 

I don't want you to feel marginalized, but when I see language like that I feel we should talk about it, rather than ignoring it. 

I do agree with you that the size of a group complaining does not matter (that is exactly what I was trying to hit on with my bolded bits).  But what matters here, and is the reason I bring it up, is not misrepresenting a personal opinion as some kind of universal 'majority' truth.

>Aw, jeez you're going to hafta put me on your naughty list too because I also don't think Sona is 'unplayable'

You're low silver, Sona's never going to be unplayable in low silver. But quite frankly low silver isn't an elo I care about. If the only place a champ can be good is silver/bronze they're an objectively bad champion.

Get to plat or diamond and Sona's unplayable. She's legit the worst support in the game right now.

>I'm happy to hear what you dislike or like about the champion but...people play her. Objectively, she is playable.

Except they don't. Her plat+ playrate is 4.5%, and it drops to 3.5% in diamond. The average for a support is 7.19%.

By all metrics Sona is complete garbage, the fact that you're still trying to act like she's not or defend the opinion that Riot was somehow right on this one shows the huge issues with bias in Riot as a company.

> You're low silver, Sona's never going to be unplayable in low silver. But quite frankly low silver isn't an elo I care about. If the only place a champ can be good is silver/bronze they're an objectively bad champion.

Alright, Plat and Diamond are not elo's I care about. It's a minority anyways. See how well that line of thought goes?

Here's the difference, if Sona's unplayable in high elos those players can't just learn to play better, if we're talking about high Diamond to Challenger those players would already be playing Sona at close to her cap as a champion and there's nothing they can do to learn to play her better, she's just not good enough.

When we talk about low elos they can learn to play against Sona better, that space exists, it just requires them to improve at the game. That's why the game needs to be balanced around at least a decently high level, bad players can at least theoretically learn to play around a champ who's OP in low levels, good players cannot make an unplayable champ work.

That's an issue of whether champions should be balanced around their skill cap or skill floor. Sona seems to be a case of skill floor, which is good because she's balanced for a greater number of people, but bad because she's weak in high level play. Unfortunately, it's probably impossible for her to be balanced in both cases.

It is somewhat disheartening that the only response to the rather highly-upvoted complaints about the state of the game is a comment in a ~20 thread pooh-poohing those ever-so-unreasonable players.

>I'm always hoping to shed a light on how we can foster better discussions together as a Boards community. 

At the risk of this sounding a lot more blunt and snippy than I intend it to, step 1 would be addressing the stuff people are talking about, where they're talking about it. Not in side threads. Not with Rioters hanging out in Memes&Games and ignoring the hard questions.

Whether or not that's the intent, that is the message being received.

The fact of the matter is, Sona's changes *have* made her feel absolutely *awful* to play. It also sucks as a support main seeing Sona constantly targeted with the nerf bat again and again - which either means the balance team doesn't know what they're doing (not likely), or that her kit is unbalanceable and she needs to be VGU'd. If I want my team to win, I have no reason to pick her, since any other heal support does her job better. Nami has better heals, boosts, and CC.

Ah, but Sona has at least been addressed, albeit in a completely unsatisfying way.

What isn't being addressed, at all, and I think this cuts to the core of the rage, is the overall game direction when it comes to game length, snowballing, botlane-wins-game, and so forth. Nobody knows what you guys want to do, and when people say it sucks for whatever reason, they don't even get a flippant response. Not even a dismissal. Not even disagreement. They get radio silence.

Radio silence makes people assume the worst.

By this logic you can dismiss any kind of feedback or criticism.
Because it's not the majority of people complaining.

You know what?
I've played like 3 years not knowing this game has a forum of any kind (a stupid assumption).
Does that mean I agreed with every decision made by Riot, every excuse Riot used and found nothing problematic playing the game?

OF COURSE NOT

Assuming something like this is a mental shortcut which is just as bad as hyperboles and that means we can't have a productive discussion together.

I'm not advocating for dismissing anything. I am specifically speaking as to why you won't see conversations starting there (and being real about 'the majority' talk). 

In fact, I have highlighted in that comment and previous ones I think it's very important not to dismiss ANY opinions - I just don't think it's a good use of time to discuss with the hyper emotional ones (been making exceptions recently to talk about why some comments or topics aren't going to get a reply, in the hopes that it helps to foster more discussion). 

Every player's opinion is valid and we should (and do) listen to all of them. But talking, now, that's different.

Maybe have a clairvoyance post about how much traffic each website (including the international ones) gets in compared to the region's population. 

That would shut some of these people up... Maybe ...
You ignored all that complain threads that all managed to be in Hot section at once, but you comment here? Adres those discussions or don't talk at all

Maybe because balance isn't the area he works in? He won't comment on all of the balance threads because he doesn't know what the balance team is up to, and this thread in particular isn't about balance, but about the boards in general, something he *can* comment on.

This is very true. I don't work on balance and therefore do not comment on balance (which tends to dominate the topics here sometimes). 

I try to only talk about things I am directly working on because I feel to do otherwise would be misleading. 

Also happy to talk about memes. Because memes. :)

My problem is that no Rioter does comment on balance, outside the Dev Corner, and even then only in a very limited capacity. I understand why that is, I know extremely well all the problems that doing so entails, particularly the issues with differing opinions within Riot and providing 'proof' to the public. That doesn't stop it from sucking though.

Companies that make games need to figure out how to talk about balance meaningfully with their players. People brush it off as an impossible problem to solve and not their job. Well a company should make it someone's job and actually try to solve it. I don't think it's easy by any means, but as someone who has extensively studied the subject I don't think it's anywhere near impossible either.
I think this is a very fair opinion. I agree that there's a lot of difficulty with talking balance with players at all right now and that it's a hard problem worth solving.

Except....how exactly can it be fixed? Riot is already very clear on any changes they make, both in the patch notes, and on the PBE. Sometimes, they even release changes made to some champs before they even hit the PBE. Meddler also does his damnedest to give us a look behind the scenes at Riot with his Gameplay Thoughts posts, and he's basically in charge of all of balance. Despite all of this, people still get upset that Riot doesn't answer them on their specific complaint, or if their comment filled with nothing but rage gets looked over. Sure, it's one thing to not answer about something that has everyone's panties in a knot, like towers, but I believe it was Reav3 who said that they'll have a full blown blog coming out sometime soon covering exactly that.

So.....what more do want from them? Rioter's can't and won't comment on every balance thread that pops up, because not only can they not spend every waking minute on Reddit, Boards, etc., but also if they do comment on rage filled posts, they are asking for nothing more than to be blasted left, right, and center unless they say exactly what the people want to hear, which may very well not be true, and could end up making the situation far worse than it already is.

And so, we end being caught between a rock and hard place. How exactly do you think we can get "un-caught"?

I'm trying to find the right words to say this but like - I get to pick where I post. So does everyone else here on Boards. Sorry, but I'm not going to accept you telling me not to talk. 

You sound frustrated but this is not a productive comment because it's both vague and hostile. Normally I would skip over replying to a comment like this, but I think it's important to understand why you may not be getting the responses you're looking for, since that seems to be part of why you're frustrated.
